wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Fraser  (18 February 1911 – 21 November 1988) was Scottish coal miner and trade unionist, who was a Labour Member of Parliament (MP) for the Hamilton constituency between 1943 and 1967.

link_mentions.page: Royal Commission on Local Government in Scotland
response: *Thomas Fraser, Labour MP for Hamilton and former Secretary of State for Transport.
The Hamilton by-election of 1943 was held on 29 January 1943.  The by-election was held due to the death of the incumbent Labour MP, Duncan Graham.  It was won by the Labour candidate Thomas Fraser.
